metadata.description: AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner (CCP) practice questions with detailed explanations

questions.question: You have set up consolidated billing for several AWS accounts. One of the accounts has purchased a number of reserved instances for 3 years. Which of the following is true regarding this scenario?
options: The Reserved Instance discounts can only be shared with the master account.
All accounts can receive the hourly cost benefit of the Reserved Instances.
The purchased instances will have better performance than On-demand instances.
There are no cost benefits from using consolidated billing; It is for informational purposes only.
questions.explanation: Consolidated billing allows you to consolidate payment for multiple AWS accounts into a single bill. However, Reserved Instance discounts are only shared with the master account that purchased them. The other accounts in the consolidated billing family cannot automatically benefit from the Reserved Instance pricing. This is a key limitation of consolidated billing - while it provides centralized billing and potential volume discounts, Reserved Instance benefits remain with the purchasing account.
keyPoints: Consolidated billing centralizes payment for multiple AWS accounts
Reserved Instance discounts are only shared with the master account
Other accounts in the billing family don't automatically get RI benefits
Consolidated billing is primarily for centralized billing management
Volume discounts may apply across the entire billing family

questions.question: What does AWS Snowball provide? (Choose TWO)
options: Built-in computing capabilities that allow customers to process data locally.
A catalog of third-party software solutions that customers need to build solutions and run their businesses.
A hybrid cloud storage between on-premises environments and the AWS Cloud.
An Exabyte-scale data transfer service that allows you to move extremely large amounts of data to AWS.
Secure transfer of large amounts of data into and out of the AWS.
questions.explanation: AWS Snowball is a petabyte-scale data transport solution that uses secure appliances to transfer large amounts of data into and out of AWS. It provides built-in computing capabilities (Snowball Edge) that allow customers to process data locally before transferring it to AWS. This is particularly useful for scenarios where internet connectivity is limited or when you need to process data before uploading. Snowball is not a catalog of third-party software, nor is it a hybrid cloud storage service - it's specifically designed for secure, large-scale data transfer.
keyPoints: AWS Snowball is for petabyte-scale data transfer
Snowball Edge provides local computing capabilities
Secure appliances are used for data transport
Ideal for limited internet connectivity scenarios
Supports both import and export of data to/from AWS

questions.question: An organization has a large number of technical employees who operate their AWS Cloud infrastructure. What does AWS provide to help organize them into teams and then assign the appropriate permissions for each team?
questions.explanation: IAM user groups allow you to organize IAM users into logical collections and assign permissions to the group rather than to individual users. This makes it much easier to manage permissions for large numbers of users by simply adding or removing users from groups. IAM roles are for granting permissions to AWS services or temporary access, while IAM users are individual accounts. AWS Organizations is for managing multiple AWS accounts, not for organizing users within a single account.
keyPoints: IAM user groups organize users into logical collections
Permissions are assigned to groups, not individual users
Simplifies permission management for large organizations
Users can belong to multiple groups
Follows the principle of least privilege

questions.question: Which of the following helps a customer view the Amazon EC2 billing activity for the past month?
questions.explanation: AWS Cost & Usage Reports provide detailed billing information including EC2 usage and costs. These reports contain comprehensive data about your AWS usage and can be used to analyze costs, track usage trends, and identify cost optimization opportunities. AWS Budgets is for setting spending limits and alerts, AWS Pricing Calculator is for estimating costs before deployment, and AWS Systems Manager is for managing EC2 instances and other AWS resources.
keyPoints: Cost & Usage Reports provide detailed billing information
Can be used for cost analysis and optimization
Contains comprehensive usage data
Supports various output formats (CSV, Parquet)
Can be delivered to S3 buckets for analysis

questions.question: You want to run a questionnaire application for only one day (without interruption), which Amazon EC2 purchase option should you use?
questions.explanation: On-demand instances are the best choice for short-term, uninterrupted workloads. They provide the highest flexibility with no upfront costs or long-term commitments. Since you need the application to run without interruption for exactly one day, on-demand instances ensure availability. Spot instances could be interrupted, reserved instances require longer commitments, and dedicated instances are for compliance requirements, not short-term usage.
keyPoints: On-demand instances provide maximum flexibility
No upfront costs or long-term commitments
Ideal for short-term, uninterrupted workloads
Pay only for what you use
Highest cost per hour but no commitment risk

questions.question: Which of the following services allows customers to manage their agreements with AWS?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact is a self-service portal for on-demand access to AWS compliance reports and select online agreements. It allows customers to download AWS compliance reports (such as SOC, PCI DSS, ISO, etc.) and manage their agreements with AWS. AWS Certificate Manager is for SSL/TLS certificates, AWS Systems Manager is for managing AWS resources, and AWS Organizations is for managing multiple AWS accounts.
keyPoints: AWS Artifact provides access to compliance reports
Self-service portal for agreements and reports
Includes SOC, PCI DSS, ISO compliance documents
No additional cost for using AWS Artifact
Supports various compliance frameworks

questions.question: Which of the following are examples of AWS-Managed Services, where AWS is responsible for the operational and maintenance burdens of running the service? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB and Amazon EMR are fully managed services where AWS handles the underlying infrastructure, scaling, patching, and maintenance. With DynamoDB, AWS manages the database servers, replication, and scaling. With EMR, AWS manages the Hadoop cluster infrastructure. Amazon VPC, IAM, and EC2 are infrastructure services where customers have more responsibility for management and configuration.
keyPoints: Managed services reduce operational overhead
AWS handles infrastructure management and scaling
DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database
EMR is a managed big data platform
Customers focus on application logic, not infrastructure

questions.question: Which of the following must an IAM user provide to interact with AWS services using the AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI)?
questions.explanation: Access keys (Access Key ID and Secret Access Key) are required for programmatic access to AWS services through the CLI, SDKs, or APIs. These keys are used to authenticate and authorize requests to AWS services. Username and password are used for console access, while UserID and Secret token are not standard AWS authentication methods.
keyPoints: Access keys consist of Access Key ID and Secret Access Key
Required for programmatic access to AWS
Should be rotated regularly for security
Different from console username/password
Can be restricted with IAM policies

questions.question: Select TWO examples of the AWS shared controls.
questions.explanation: Patch Management and Configuration Management are shared controls in the AWS shared responsibility model. AWS is responsible for patching the underlying infrastructure, while customers are responsible for patching their applications and operating systems. Configuration management is also shared - AWS manages the configuration of the cloud infrastructure, while customers manage the configuration of their applications and data.
keyPoints: Shared controls require cooperation between AWS and customers
Patch management is split between infrastructure and applications
Configuration management covers both platform and customer resources
AWS handles cloud infrastructure configuration
Customers handle application and data configuration

questions.question: In order to implement best practices when dealing with a "Single Point of Failure," you should attempt to build as much automation as possible in both detecting and reacting to failure. Which of the following AWS services would help? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Elastic Load Balancer (ELB) and Auto Scaling help eliminate single points of failure by distributing traffic across multiple instances and automatically replacing failed instances. ELB provides redundancy by routing traffic to healthy instances, while Auto Scaling ensures that failed instances are automatically replaced and the desired capacity is maintained. This automation helps detect and react to failures without manual intervention.
keyPoints: ELB distributes traffic across multiple instances
Auto Scaling automatically replaces failed instances
Both services provide high availability
Automation reduces manual intervention during failures
Helps eliminate single points of failure

questions.question: Under the shared responsibility model, which of the following is the responsibility of AWS?
questions.explanation: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for the security 'of' the cloud, which includes configuring and securing the underlying infrastructure devices, data centers, and hardware. Client-side encryption, server-side encryption configuration, and Security Groups are customer responsibilities as they relate to security 'in' the cloud.
keyPoints: AWS is responsible for security 'of' the cloud
Infrastructure device configuration is AWS responsibility
Customers are responsible for security 'in' the cloud
Data center security is handled by AWS
Hardware and virtualization security is AWS responsibility

questions.question: What does the AWS Health Dashboard provide? (Choose TWO)
options: Detailed troubleshooting guidance to address AWS events impacting your resources.
Health checks for Auto Scaling instances.
A dashboard detailing vulnerabilities in your applications.
Personalized view of AWS service health.
questions.explanation: The AWS Health Dashboard provides a personalized view of AWS service health and detailed troubleshooting guidance for events that may impact your resources. It shows service events, planned maintenance, and provides specific guidance for affected resources. It does not provide health checks for Auto Scaling instances, cost optimization recommendations, or application vulnerability details.
keyPoints: Provides personalized service health information
Shows events that may impact your resources
Includes detailed troubleshooting guidance
Covers both general and account-specific events
Helps with incident response and planning

questions.question: Which of the following is not a benefit of Amazon S3? (Choose TWO)
options: Amazon S3 provides unlimited storage for any type of data.
Amazon S3 can run any type of application or backend system.
Amazon S3 stores any number of objects, but with object size limits.
Amazon S3 can be scaled manually to store and retrieve any amount of data from anywhere.
Amazon S3 provides 99.999999999% (11 9's) of data durability.
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 is an object storage service, not a compute service, so it cannot run applications or backend systems. Additionally, S3 scales automatically - there's no manual scaling required. S3 does provide unlimited storage, high durability (11 9's), and can store any number of objects (with individual object size limits of 5TB).
keyPoints: S3 is object storage, not compute
S3 scales automatically, no manual intervention needed
S3 provides unlimited storage capacity
Individual objects are limited to 5TB
S3 offers 99.999999999% data durability

questions.question: What does AWS provide to deploy popular technologies such as IBM MQ on AWS with the least amount of effort and time?
questions.explanation: AWS Quick Start reference deployments provide pre-built CloudFormation templates and deployment guides for popular technologies like IBM MQ. These templates automate the deployment process and follow AWS best practices, significantly reducing the time and effort required to deploy complex solutions. They include security configurations, monitoring, and other production-ready features.
keyPoints: Quick Start provides pre-built CloudFormation templates
Automates deployment of popular technologies
Follows AWS best practices
Includes security and monitoring configurations
Reduces deployment time and complexity

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT correct regarding Amazon EC2 On-demand instances?
options: You have to pay a start-up fee when launching a new instance for the first time.
The on-demand instances follow the AWS pay-as-you-go pricing model.
With on-demand instances, no longer-term commitments or upfront payments are needed.
When using on-demand Linux instances, you are charged per second based on an hourly rate.
questions.explanation: On-demand instances do NOT require any start-up fees. They follow a true pay-as-you-go model where you only pay for the compute time you use, with no upfront costs, long-term commitments, or start-up fees. The per-second billing (for Linux instances) and lack of upfront payments are key benefits of on-demand instances.
keyPoints: No start-up fees for on-demand instances
True pay-as-you-go pricing model
No upfront costs or long-term commitments
Per-second billing for Linux instances
Maximum flexibility with no financial commitment

questions.question: A company is introducing a new product to their customers, and is expecting a surge in traffic to their web application. As part of their Enterprise Support plan, which of the following provides the company with architectural and scaling guidance?
questions.explanation: Infrastructure Event Management (IEM) is an Enterprise Support feature that provides architectural and scaling guidance for planned events like product launches. AWS experts work with you to review your architecture, identify potential issues, and provide recommendations for handling increased traffic. This is specifically designed for planned events where you expect significant traffic increases.
keyPoints: IEM is available with Enterprise Support
Provides architectural guidance for planned events
Helps prepare for traffic surges
Includes AWS expert consultation
Designed for product launches and major events

questions.question: According to the AWS Acceptable Use Policy, which of the following statements is true regarding penetration testing of EC2 instances?
options: Penetration testing is not allowed in AWS.
Penetration testing is performed automatically by AWS to determine vulnerabilities in your AWS infrastructure.
Penetration testing can be performed by the customer on their own instances without prior authorization from AWS.
The AWS customers are only allowed to perform penetration testing on services managed by AWS.
questions.explanation: AWS allows customers to perform penetration testing on their own EC2 instances without prior authorization, as long as it's against their own infrastructure and follows AWS guidelines. However, testing against AWS infrastructure or other customers' resources is not permitted. AWS does not automatically perform penetration testing on customer infrastructure.
keyPoints: Customers can test their own EC2 instances
No prior authorization required for self-testing
Testing must be against your own infrastructure
AWS infrastructure testing is not permitted
Must follow AWS security guidelines

questions.question: An organization needs to analyze and process a large number of data sets. Which AWS service should they use?
questions.explanation: Amazon EMR (Elastic MapReduce) is designed for big data processing and analytics. It provides a managed Hadoop framework that can process large amounts of data using distributed computing. Amazon MQ is a message broker service, SNS is for notifications, and SQS is for message queuing - none of these are designed for large-scale data processing and analytics.
keyPoints: EMR is designed for big data processing
Uses Hadoop framework for distributed computing
Can process large datasets efficiently
Supports various big data tools (Spark, Hive, etc.)
Managed service reduces operational overhead

questions.question: What are the change management tools that helps AWS customers audit and monitor all resource changes in their AWS environment? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail logs all API calls and user activity, providing an audit trail of who did what and when. AWS Config continuously monitors and records your AWS resource configurations, allowing you to track changes over time and assess compliance. Together, these services provide comprehensive change management and auditing capabilities. The other services are for different purposes: Comprehend (NLP), Transit Gateway (networking), and X-Ray (application tracing).
keyPoints: CloudTrail logs all API calls and user activity
AWS Config monitors resource configurations
Both services provide audit trails
Essential for compliance and security
Help track unauthorized changes

questions.question: Which of the following services allows you to run containerized applications on a cluster of EC2 instances?
questions.explanation: Amazon ECS (Elastic Container Service) is a fully managed container orchestration service that allows you to run containerized applications on a cluster of EC2 instances. It handles the deployment, scaling, and management of containers. AWS Data Pipeline is for data processing workflows, Cloud9 is an IDE, and Personal Health Dashboard is for monitoring AWS service health.
keyPoints: ECS is a managed container orchestration service
Runs on EC2 instances in a cluster
Handles deployment and scaling of containers
Supports Docker containers
Integrates with other AWS services

questions.question: A company is migrating its on-premises database to Amazon RDS. What should the company do to ensure Amazon RDS costs are kept to a minimum?
options: Combine On-demand Capacity Reservations with Saving Plans.
questions.explanation: Right-sizing resources before and after migration ensures that you are not over-provisioning or under-provisioning your Amazon RDS instances. This helps minimize costs by matching the instance size to the actual workload requirements. Multi-Region architectures and capacity reservations are more expensive and are used for high availability or disaster recovery, not cost minimization.
keyPoints: Right-sizing matches resources to workload needs
Reduces unnecessary costs
Should be done before and after migration
Over-provisioning leads to wasted spend
Under-provisioning can impact performance

questions.question: What is the primary storage service used by Amazon RDS database instances?
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS uses Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS) as its primary storage service for database instances. EBS provides block-level storage volumes that are highly available and durable, making them ideal for database workloads. Amazon S3 and Glacier are object storage services, and EFS is a file storage service.
keyPoints: RDS uses EBS for block-level storage
EBS is highly available and durable
Optimized for database workloads
S3 and Glacier are object storage, not block storage
EFS is for file storage, not databases

questions.question: Which of the following AWS services is designed with native Multi-AZ fault tolerance in mind? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 and DynamoDB are designed to be natively multi-AZ, providing high availability and fault tolerance by replicating data across multiple Availability Zones. Redshift, Snowball, and EBS do not provide native multi-AZ fault tolerance in the same way.
keyPoints: S3 and DynamoDB are natively multi-AZ
High availability and fault tolerance
Data is automatically replicated
No manual configuration required
Supports mission-critical workloads

questions.question: Under the Shared Responsibility Model, which of the following controls do customers fully inherit from AWS? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Customers fully inherit environmental and physical controls from AWS, as these are managed entirely by AWS in their data centers. Patch management, database, and training controls are either shared or customer responsibilities.
keyPoints: Environmental and physical controls are AWS responsibility
Customers inherit these controls
Patch management is shared
Database controls are customer responsibility
Training is customer responsibility

questions.question: Your application has recently experienced significant global growth, and international users are complaining of high latency. What is the AWS characteristic that can help improve your international users' experience?
questions.explanation: AWS's global reach, with its network of regions and edge locations, allows you to deploy resources closer to your users, reducing latency and improving performance for international users. Elasticity, durability, and high availability are important, but global reach specifically addresses latency for geographically distributed users.
keyPoints: Global reach reduces latency for international users
AWS has regions and edge locations worldwide
Resources can be deployed close to users
Improves application performance
Supports global business expansion

questions.question: Savings Plans are available for which of the following AWS compute services? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Savings Plans are flexible pricing models that apply to Amazon EC2 and AWS Lambda usage. They allow you to save money compared to on-demand pricing by committing to a consistent amount of usage. Savings Plans do not apply to AWS Batch, Outposts, or Lightsail.
keyPoints: Savings Plans apply to EC2 and Lambda
Offer significant cost savings over on-demand pricing
Require a usage commitment
Do not apply to all compute services
Flexible across instance families and regions

questions.question: A company has business critical workloads hosted on AWS and they are unwilling to accept any downtime. Which of the following is a recommended best practice to protect their workloads in the event of an unexpected natural disaster?
options: Replicate data across multiple Edge Locations worldwide and use Amazon CloudFront to perform automatic failover in the event of an outage.
Deploy AWS resources across multiple Availability Zones within the same AWS Region.
Create point-in-time backups in another subnet and recover this data when a disaster occurs.
Deploy AWS resources to another AWS Region and implement an Active-Active disaster recovery strategy.
questions.explanation: Deploying resources to another AWS Region and implementing an Active-Active disaster recovery strategy ensures that workloads remain available even if an entire region is affected by a disaster. This is the highest level of disaster recovery and is recommended for business-critical workloads that cannot tolerate downtime.
keyPoints: Active-Active DR spans multiple regions
Ensures high availability during regional outages
Recommended for business-critical workloads
Minimizes downtime and data loss
Requires careful planning and replication

questions.question: What are the connectivity options that can be used to build hybrid cloud architectures? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: AWS Direct Connect and AWS VPN are the primary connectivity options for building hybrid cloud architectures, allowing secure and reliable connections between on-premises environments and AWS. Direct Connect provides a dedicated network connection, while VPN provides encrypted connectivity over the internet.
keyPoints: Direct Connect offers dedicated network connectivity
VPN provides encrypted internet connectivity
Both enable hybrid cloud architectures
Support secure data transfer
Can be used together for redundancy

questions.question: A company has deployed a new web application on multiple Amazon EC2 instances. Which of the following should they use to ensure that the incoming HTTP traffic is distributed evenly across the instances?
questions.explanation: AWS Application Load Balancer (ALB) is designed to distribute HTTP and HTTPS traffic across multiple EC2 instances, providing high availability and fault tolerance for web applications. Auto Scaling is for adjusting the number of instances, and Network Load Balancer is for TCP/UDP traffic.
keyPoints: ALB distributes HTTP/HTTPS traffic
Provides high availability and fault tolerance
Supports advanced routing features
Auto Scaling adjusts instance count, not traffic
Network Load Balancer is for TCP/UDP traffic

questions.question: Which of the following can help protect your EC2 instances from DDoS attacks? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Security Groups and Network ACLs are AWS networking features that help protect EC2 instances from DDoS and other network-based attacks by controlling inbound and outbound traffic. CloudHSM is for cryptographic operations, Batch is for batch computing, and IAM is for identity management.
keyPoints: Security Groups act as virtual firewalls
Network ACLs provide subnet-level security
Both help mitigate DDoS and unauthorized access
CloudHSM is not for DDoS protection
IAM is for identity, not network security

questions.question: Which of the following should be considered when performing a TCO analysis to compare the costs of running an application on AWS instead of on-premises?
questions.explanation: Physical hardware costs are a major component of on-premises TCO and are eliminated or reduced when moving to AWS. Application development, market research, and business analysis are not directly related to infrastructure TCO.
keyPoints: TCO analysis compares on-premises and cloud costs
Physical hardware is a major on-premises cost
AWS eliminates/reduces hardware costs
Other costs include power, cooling, and maintenance
Development and research are not TCO factors

questions.question: What are the benefits of using the Amazon Relational Database Service? (Choose TWO)
options: Complete control over the underlying host.
Scales automatically to larger or smaller instance types.
Supports the document and key-value data structure.
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS reduces administrative burden by automating backups, patching, and maintenance. It also provides resizable compute capacity, allowing you to scale resources as needed. Complete control over the host is not provided, and RDS is not a document/key-value store.
keyPoints: RDS automates backups and maintenance
Reduces administrative overhead
Compute capacity is resizable
Not a document or key-value store
No host-level access for customers

questions.question: What is the minimum level of AWS support that provides 24x7 access to technical support engineers via phone and chat?
questions.explanation: Business Support is the minimum AWS support plan that provides 24x7 access to technical support engineers via phone and chat. Developer Support provides business hours access, and Basic Support does not include direct access to support engineers.
keyPoints: Business Support provides 24x7 access to engineers
Enterprise Support also provides 24x7 access
Developer Support is business hours only
Basic Support has no direct engineer access
Phone and chat support included in Business plan

questions.question: A company has developed a media transcoding application in AWS. The application is designed to recover quickly from hardware failures. Which one of the following types of instance would be the most cost-effective choice to use?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances are the most cost-effective option for workloads that can tolerate interruptions and recover quickly from hardware failures. They offer significant discounts compared to On-Demand and Reserved Instances, but can be interrupted by AWS with little notice.
keyPoints: Spot Instances offer the lowest cost
Best for fault-tolerant, flexible workloads
Can be interrupted by AWS
Not suitable for critical, persistent workloads
Ideal for batch and stateless applications

questions.question: A company has hundreds of VPCs in multiple AWS Regions worldwide. What service does AWS offer to simplify the connection management among the VPCs?
questions.explanation: AWS Transit Gateway simplifies the management of connectivity among hundreds of VPCs across multiple regions. It acts as a central hub for connecting VPCs and on-premises networks, reducing the complexity of managing many peering connections.
keyPoints: Transit Gateway is a central hub for VPC connectivity
Simplifies network management
Supports inter-region and on-premises connections
Reduces peering complexity
Scales to thousands of VPCs

questions.question: What is one benefit and one drawback of buying a reserved EC2 instance? (Select TWO)
options: Instances can be shut down by AWS at any time with no notification.
Reserved instances require at least a one-year pricing commitment.
There is no additional charge for using dedicated instances.
Reserved instances provide a significant discount compared to on-demand instances.
Reserved instances are best suited for periodic workloads.
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances provide a significant discount compared to On-Demand pricing, but require a one-year or three-year commitment. They are best for steady-state workloads, not periodic workloads. AWS does not shut down reserved instances without notice, and dedicated instances have separate pricing.
keyPoints: Reserved Instances offer cost savings
Require a long-term commitment
Best for steady-state workloads
Not suitable for periodic or unpredictable workloads
Dedicated instances have separate pricing

questions.question: What is the most cost-effective purchasing option for running a set of EC2 instances that must always be available for a period of two months?
questions.explanation: On-Demand Instances are the most cost-effective for short-term, always-on workloads that last less than a year. Reserved Instances require a minimum one-year commitment, and Spot Instances can be interrupted, making them unsuitable for always-on requirements.
keyPoints: On-Demand is best for short-term, always-on workloads
No long-term commitment required
Reserved Instances require at least one year
Spot Instances can be interrupted
On-Demand offers flexibility for short durations

questions.question: A developer needs to set up an SSL security certificate for a client's eCommerce website in order to use the HTTPS protocol. Which of the following AWS services can be used to deploy the required SSL server certificates? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Amazon Route 53 and AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) can be used to deploy SSL/TLS certificates for secure websites. ACM manages the provisioning, deployment, and renewal of certificates, while Route 53 is used for DNS management and can integrate with ACM for secure domain validation.
keyPoints: ACM manages SSL/TLS certificates
Route 53 integrates with ACM for DNS validation
Certificates enable HTTPS for secure communication
ACM automates certificate renewal
IAM can store but not deploy SSL certificates

questions.question: Which support plan includes AWS Support Concierge Service?
questions.explanation: Enterprise Support includes the AWS Support Concierge Service, which provides account and billing assistance. Business Support does not include the Concierge Service.
keyPoints: Enterprise Support includes Concierge Service
Concierge provides account and billing assistance
Business Support does not include Concierge
Premium/Standard Support are not AWS plans
Concierge helps with non-technical issues

questions.question: A company is planning to migrate a database with high read/write activity to AWS. What is the best storage option to use?
questions.explanation: Amazon EBS (Elastic Block Store) is the best storage option for databases with high read/write activity. It provides low-latency, high-performance block storage that is ideal for database workloads. S3 and Glacier are object storage services, and Storage Gateway is for hybrid storage integration.
keyPoints: EBS is optimized for high-performance databases
Provides low-latency block storage
S3 and Glacier are not suitable for databases
Storage Gateway is for hybrid storage
EBS supports snapshots and backups

questions.question: How can AWS customers track and avoid over-spending on underutilized reserved instances?
options: Customers can add all AWS accounts to an AWS Organization, enable Consolidated Billing, and turn off Reserved Instance sharing.
Customers can use Amazon Neptune to track and analyze their usage patterns, detect underutilized reserved instances, and then sell them on the Amazon EC2 Reserved Instance Marketplace.
Customers can use the AWS Budgets service to track the reserved instances usage and set up alert notifications when their utilization drops below the threshold that they define.
Customers can use Amazon CloudTrail to automatically check for unused reservations and get recommendations to reduce their bill.
questions.explanation: AWS Budgets allows customers to set custom cost and usage budgets and receive alerts when usage exceeds thresholds, including for reserved instance utilization. This helps avoid overspending on underutilized resources. Neptune is a graph database, and CloudTrail is for auditing API calls, not cost tracking.
keyPoints: AWS Budgets tracks reserved instance usage
Custom alerts help avoid overspending
Neptune is not for cost tracking
CloudTrail is for API auditing
Budgets can be set for cost and usage

questions.question: What does AWS Service Catalog provide?
options: It enables customers to quickly find descriptions and use cases for AWS services.
It enables customers to explore the different catalogs of AWS services.
It simplifies organizing and governing commonly deployed IT services.
It allows developers to deploy infrastructure on AWS using familiar programming languages.
questions.explanation: AWS Service Catalog allows organizations to create and manage catalogs of IT services that are approved for use on AWS. It simplifies governance and helps ensure compliance by controlling which services and versions are available to users.
keyPoints: Service Catalog manages approved IT services
Simplifies governance and compliance
Controls which services are available to users
Not for exploring all AWS services
Helps standardize deployments

questions.question: Which of the following AWS Services helps with planning application migration to the AWS Cloud?
questions.explanation: AWS Application Discovery Service helps plan application migration by collecting usage and configuration data from on-premises servers, which can be used to estimate migration effort and costs. DMS is for database migration, and Migration Hub tracks migration progress.
keyPoints: Application Discovery Service collects server data
Helps estimate migration effort and cost
DMS is for database migration
Migration Hub tracks migration progress
Discovery Service is for planning, not execution

questions.question: A company is trying to analyze the costs applied to their AWS account recently. Which of the following provides them the most granular data about their AWS costs and usage?
questions.explanation: AWS Cost & Usage Report provides the most detailed and granular data about AWS costs and usage, down to the resource level. Cost Explorer is for visualizing and analyzing costs, but the Cost & Usage Report is the raw data source.
keyPoints: Cost & Usage Report is the most granular
Provides resource-level cost data
Cost Explorer is for visualization
CloudWatch is for monitoring, not billing
Machine Images are not related to billing

questions.question: TYMO Cloud Corp is looking forward to migrating their entire on-premises data center to AWS. What tool can they use to perform a cost-benefit analysis of moving to the AWS Cloud?
questions.explanation: The AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Calculator helps organizations compare the cost of running workloads on AWS with on-premises environments, including hardware, software, and operational costs.
keyPoints: TCO Calculator compares AWS and on-premises costs
Includes hardware, software, and operational costs
Cost Explorer is for AWS usage only
Budgets is for cost control, not analysis
Pricing Calculator estimates AWS costs only

questions.question: Which of the following activities supports the Operational Excellence pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?
options: Using AWS Trusted Advisor to find underutilized resources.
Using AWS CloudTrail to record user activities.
Using AWS CloudFormation to manage infrastructure as code.
Deploying an application in multiple Availability Zones.
questions.explanation: Using AWS CloudFormation to manage infrastructure as code supports the Operational Excellence pillar by enabling repeatable, automated, and auditable infrastructure deployments.
keyPoints: CloudFormation enables infrastructure as code
Supports automation and repeatability
Operational Excellence is about continuous improvement
Trusted Advisor is for cost and security
Multi-AZ is for reliability, not operational excellence

questions.question: Which AWS database service automatically scales to meet required throughput capacity and offers single-digit millisecond latency? (Choose TWO)
options: Automatically scales to meet required throughput capacity.
Provides resizable instances to match the current demand.
Supports both relational and non-relational data models.
Supports the most popular NoSQL database engines such as CouchDB and MongoDB.
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB automatically scales throughput and provides single-digit millisecond latency, making it ideal for high-performance applications. It is a NoSQL database, not a relational database.
keyPoints: DynamoDB is a NoSQL database
Automatically scales throughput
Single-digit millisecond latency
Not a relational database
Popular for high-performance workloads
